memberdef.argsstring: (const size_t N, const VectorX< Scalar > &orbital_energies, const GTransformation< Scalar > &C)
memberdef.name: GHF

parameterdescription.para: The number of electrons.
The transformation that expresses the GHF MOs in terms of the atomic spinors.
The GHF MO energies.

detaileddescription.para: Default constructor setting everything to zero.

parameterdescription.para: The electronic spin operator.
The (spin-blocked) overlap matrix of the underlying AO bases.

simplesect.para: The expectation value of the electronic spin operator.
A matrix containing all the possible excitation energies of the wavefunction model.
The rows are determined by the number of virtual orbitals, the columns by the number of occupied orbitals.
The 1-DM expressed in an orthonormal spinor basis related to these optimal GHF parameters.
The 2-DM expressed in an orthonormal spinor basis related to these optimal GHF parameters.

detaileddescription.para: Construct the partial stability matrix A from the GHF stability conditions.

simplesect.para: The formula for the A matrix is as follows: A_IAJB = \delta_IJ * F_BA - \delta_BA * F_IJ + (AI||JB).

parameterdescription.para: The second quantized Hamiltonian, expressed in the orthonormal, 'generalized' spinor basis of the GHF MOs, which contains the necessary two-electron operators.

simplesect.para: The partial stability matrix A.

detaileddescription.para: Construct the partial stability matrix B from the GHF stability conditions.

simplesect.para: The formula for the B matrix is as follows: B_IAJB = (AI||BJ).

parameterdescription.para: The second quantized Hamiltonian, expressed in the orthonormal, 'generalized' spinor basis of the GHF MOs, which contains the necessary two-electron operators.

simplesect.para: The partial stability matrix B.
The GHF 1-DM in the scalar/AO basis related to these optimal GHF parameters.

detaileddescription.para: Calculate the GHF stability matrices and return them.

parameterdescription.para: The second quantized Hamiltonian, expressed in the orthonormal, 'generalized' spinor basis of the GHF MOs, which contains the necessary two-electron operators.

simplesect.para: The GHF stability matrices.
The transformation that expresses the GHF MOs in terms of the underlying AOs.
The number of electrons that these GHF model parameters describe.
The number of spinors that these GHF model parameters describe.
The orbital energies belonging to the occupied orbitals.
The orbital energies.

parameterdescription.para: The index of the orbital.

simplesect.para: The i-th orbital energy.
The implicit occupied-virtual orbital space that is associated to these GHF model parameters.
The orbital energies belonging to the virtual orbitals.

memberdef.argsstring: (const ScalarGSQOneElectronOperator< Scalar > &F, const G1DM< Scalar > &P, const ScalarGSQOneElectronOperator< Scalar > &S)
memberdef.name: calculateError

parameterdescription.para: The Fock operator expressed in the scalar bases.
The GHF density matrix in the same scalar bases.
The (spin-blocked) overlap operator of the scalar bases.

simplesect.para: The GHF error matrix.

memberdef.argsstring: (const G1DM< Scalar > &P, const ScalarGSQOneElectronOperator< Scalar > &H_core, const ScalarGSQOneElectronOperator< Scalar > &F)
memberdef.name: calculateElectronicEnergy

parameterdescription.para: The (spin-blocked) GHF density matrix in the scalar bases.
The (spin-blocked) core Hamiltonian expressed in the same scalar bases.
The (spin-blocked) Fock matrix in the same scalar bases.

simplesect.para: The GHF electronic energy.

parameterdescription.para: The coefficient matrix that expresses every spinor orbital (as a column) in the underlying scalar bases.
The number of electrons.

simplesect.para: The GHF 1-DM expressed in the underlying scalar basis.

parameterdescription.para: The GHF density matrix expressed in the underlying scalar orbital basis.
The Hamiltonian expressed in the scalar (AO) basis, resulting from a quantization using a GSpinorBasis.

simplesect.para: The GHF direct (Coulomb) operator.
The scalar bases for the alpha- and beta-components must be the same.

parameterdescription.para: The GHF density matrix expressed in the underlying scalar orbital bases.
The Hamiltonian expressed in the scalar (AO) basis, resulting from a quantization using a GSpinorBasis.

simplesect.para: The GHF direct (Coulomb) operator for spin sigma.

detaileddescription.para: Calculate the GHF Fock matrix F = H_core + G, in which G is a contraction of the density matrix and the two-electron integrals.

parameterdescription.para: The (spin-blocked) GHF density matrix in the scalar bases.
The Hamiltonian expressed in the scalar (AO) basis, resulting from a quantization using a GSpinorBasis.

simplesect.para: The GHF Fock operator expressed in the scalar basis.

detaileddescription.para: Calculate the GHF 1-DM expressed in an orthonormal spinor basis.

parameterdescription.para: The number of spinors.
The number of electrons.

simplesect.para: The GHF 1-DM expressed in an orthonormal spinor basis.

detaileddescription.para: Calculate the GHF 2-DM expressed in an orthonormal spinor basis.

parameterdescription.para: The number of spinors.
The number of electrons.

simplesect.para: The GHF 2-DM expressed in an orthonormal spinor basis.

parameterdescription.para: The number of spinors.
The number of electrons.

simplesect.para: The implicit (i.e. with ascending and contiguous orbital indices) occupied-virtual orbital space that corresponds to these GHF model parameters.

detaileddescription.para: The generalized Hartree-Fock wave function model.

parameterdescription.para: The type of scalar that is used for the expansion of the spinors in their underlying scalar basis.
